title: Tesla Stock Is on Pace to Mark Lowest Close Since November
text: LIVE COVERAGE | CONCLUDED Last Updated: Jan. 9, 2024 at 7:53 PM EST 3 months ago By Karishma Vanjani Tesla shares fell Tuesday, extending a decline from last week. Shares of the electric-vehicle maker declined 2.9% to $233.55 Tuesday. At the level, it would be the lowest close since November 13, according to Dow Jones Market Data. The stock has fallen seven of the past eight days, marking a gain only on Monday. The decline is coming along the broader market’s downturn as well as a Wall Street Journal article on alleged illegal drug use by CEO Elon Musk, which introduces a key person risk. This year, the stock has a high bar to clear. Tesla stock more than doubled in 2023, surging 101.72%, its best year since 2020. Tesla TSLA (U.S.: Nasdaq) Advertisement - Scroll to Continue
